--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> Mr. J wrote:
> 
> > ...
> > Which codebase do you think I should use for production purpose,
> > should I stick with 1.2 or get the HEAD from cvs ?  You guys might
> > have more idea how mature the code is in CVS.
> 
> Use HEAD. Current HEAD is very close to being 1.4.0 release candidate.

Let me add qualification to the above.  I suggested using HEAD because
its stablizing as we ready for 1.4 release, limited testng show no
glaring issues, and we ourselves have been using recent versions of
HEAD doing large crawls (HEAD also has loads of fixes, new features,
and lasts much longer before OOME'ing).  That said, for 'production
purposes', you should always use released versions of Heritrix (For
what you're trying to do, there is no change in canonicalization rules
API so it should be easy bringing forward 1.2 rules).

Yours,
St.Ack
